MAJORITY CAUCUS CHAIRMAN

MAJORITY CAUCUS CHAIRMAN
April 24, 1961
PAUL W. CORNETT
MINORITY CAUCUS CHAIRMAN
O. O. DUNCAN
MINORITY CAUCUS CHAIRMAN
CHARLES WHEELER
DIRECTOR
Dear Len,
A short report. Friday afternoon I went down to the Governor’s office
to check on the Oren Harris comraunication picture. Much scurrying about and
asking people if they had seen anythihg come in. Ed Fossett said he had
alerted everyone. No results, though.
Appears to be some chance that if anything came in it was routed over to
Wendell Butler by Wendell Ford. Fossett had to remind him that he had been
asked to keep an eye out for such a communique.
Suggest that Harold Hill direct an inquiry to the Hill about the subject.
Should Harris s-c staff claim they sent request, then chances are good that
the thing did come in and was referred to Education. If it was handled in
this fashion, Lord only knows what came or will come out of it.
Asked Billingsley (privately) what his views on mentioning ChaAhel 10
in '-'ommittee^ meeting were. He was puzzled about Hudson’s not mentioning it.
If WAVE doesn’t imow about it, they evidently have not been too thorough in
their engineering. If they do know about it, why haven’t they mentioned it?
Probably very simple answer to whole thing. My problem is that 1 do not trust
businessmen any more-only government employees.
A11 for now.
Ed
